name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel San Pedro

reviews.text: Stayed for 1 night whist touring around LA, cant fault the Hotel, great service, clean, friendly staff, Pool & Hot tub Good, food was good in Hotel, had dinner & breakfast, Free Pool in Bar Area , kept the childrenn quiet whilst we enjoyed a beer , Marina Offers good views, love the boats !
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: Free Parking, my only moan is they charge for internet in the rooms, nowadays , most hotels offer for free, well done doubletree for making our stay welcome and enjoyable thank you
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, dumpy area

reviews.text: San Pedro has gone down hill.....decent hotel, if the Marina weren't there, nothing to look at. Bar Service was lacking. Rooms have been nicely redone although the bathrooms could use some attention.
reviews.title: WORST stay at a Hilton affiliated Hotel EVER

reviews.text: My wife and I booked a cruise with my side of the family and decided to spend one night in San Pedro before we embarked on the ship. We booked our own room and the other three members of my family got the room next door which was adjoined. So far so good. We were told to talk to the bell desk to arrange for transport in the morning to the cruise ship, but no one was there. After waiting by the bell desk for 10 minutes, we decided to just go upstairs and come back later.
reviews.title: TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE

reviews.text: As we walked through the hotel to get to our room, we noticed the hallway doors were propped open by rag towels stuffed under the doors. EVERY single hallway door was propped up as such. Upon arrival at our room on the third floor (we stayed in room 306 and my family in 308, we saw that the rooms had probably not been renovated since the 1980s or early 90s. The bathroom floor tile had a sticky film or oil that you could feel with even your shoes and the air conditioner was creaking and rusted. One of our bath towels had a yellow/ brown stain on it that was visible while hanging. The air conditioner was actually only blowing regular air and wasn't working properly at all. We opened the window since it was cool outside, but the window opened only 3-4 inches. We decided to go back downstairs and not worry about it since we were tired and checked in late as it was.
reviews.title: Upcoming Pre-Cruise Stay - Great Customer Service Experience
Shoking room maintance with water damage and leaks.
reviews.text: Initially a pretty average hotel. First room at the end of the building suffered from inconsistent hot water in the shower going cold then hot repeatedly. A guest I met had a similar experience. After a complaint I was "upgraded" to a room which was on paper supposed to be nicer. Once I was in the room, I noticed it had a connecting locked door which was beside another room full of Air Tahiti crew partying into the early hours of the morning. Rather than telling them to respect other guest they made me move to another room which had water damage with a giant dripping wet patch on the roof which leaked onto my laptop. I was given a considerable discount for my one week stay but this still didn’t compensate. I would avoid this hotel at all costs.
-fast foiod quality in the dining room...just gross food, but good service
reviews.title: Stay somewhere else

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -event rooms are below the Hotel rooms and they blast music so loud you can't hear anything (parties last until midnight)
reviews.title: Warm Cookies!

reviews.text: -hot water issues
reviews.title: Ver comfortable

reviews.text: -ac unit non-functional
reviews.title: Quality Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were fortunate to spend 24 hours at this nice hotel prior to starting a cruise ship vacation. There are a few other hotels closer to the Port of Los Angeles but none will have such a great view of yachts and sailboats of all shapes and sizes. The hotel does a brisk cruise ship business and offers free shuttles as well as park and cruise. The proximity to various yacht clubs, restaurants, marinas and the busy Port of Los Angeles makes this an interesting and convenient place to stay. The staff at the hotel were efficient and even the on-site restaurant provides better than average meals served on a nice patio with a view of the marina. The building is not fancy but in good condition and the marina view rooms make you feel a part of the action!
reviews.title: From Boats to Ships!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: rented a limo through the hotel to get here from LAX - 4 people, 5 large bags - $95
reviews.title: great pre-cruise hotel

reviews.text: we are hilton honors so both rooms were upgraded to balcony and free great breakfast buffet
reviews.title: Great hotel for pre-cruise stay and park!!

reviews.text: lovely view of marina
reviews.title: Good for a night

reviews.text: dinner in restaurant here reasonable and fine
reviews.title: Good hotel, Great location

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for one night prior to going on a cruise that was leaving from San Pedro. The hotel allowed us to park our car in their lot for the week we were gone and provided shuttle service to and from hotel to the pier.
reviews.title: Great hotel to stay when going on a cruise out of San Pedro

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room is comfortable and clean. Quiet. The food at the restaurant is good. So after a long drive to the hotel on the night before we were departing for the cruise, it's great to be able to relax in the hotel and not have to go out again. The shuttle service was fast and efficient.
reviews.title: Nice view from the room!!

reviews.text: Overall this is a great place to stay at a good price.
reviews.title: This is the place to stay pre-cruise......
